intro: Filipendula lobata var. venusta-magnifica, commonly known as the showy swamp rose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the northeastern United States. It features showy, pink to red floral clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along stream banks. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
